title: Evolution of bacteria in a lab

content.description:
Read each question carefully. Write your response in the space provided for each part of each question. Answers must be written out in paragraph form. Outlines, bulleted lists, or diagrams alone are not acceptable and will not be scored.

Researchers grew populations of identical Escherichia coli (<math alttext="E coli" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext mathvariant="italic">E. coli</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>) bacteria in a growth medium that contained a low concentration of glucose and a high concentration of citrate, a substance that is not typically consumed by <math alttext="E coli" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext mathvariant="italic">E. coli</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. For thousands of generations, the bacteria used only glucose as an energy source and grew relatively slowly and to a low density because of the low concentration of glucose. After about <math alttext="30,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><mtext>,000</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> generations, one population emerged that began to rapidly grow to a much higher density. The researchers hypothesized that the bacteria evolved the ability to use citrate as an energy source and referred to them as <math alttext="C i t plus" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cit</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. To test the hypothesis, the researchers grew separate populations of the <math alttext="C i t plus" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cit</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> bacteria and bacteria from the original population (<math alttext="C i t minus" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cit</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>) in a growth medium that contained only citrate.
content.question: (a) Describe one outcome that would demonstrate that a given population has evolved.

frqParts.text: (a) Describe one outcome that would demonstrate that a given population has evolved.
(b) Identify the dependent variable measured in the experiments.

(c) Predict the results obtained by the researchers when they grew the <math alttext="C i t plus" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cit</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C i t minus" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cit</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> bacteria in the medium that contained only citrate.

(d) The researchers claim that the <math alttext="C i t plus" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cit</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> mutation increases the fitness of the bacteria. Provide reasoning to support the claim.
